summary: This FBI 302 form documents the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein on July 6, 2019, at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey. It details the execution of a federal arrest warrant for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, his processing, and the law enforcement personnel involved. The document serves as the official record of his apprehension.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the federal arrest warrant for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking. He was arrested upon arrival at Teterboro Airport from Paris.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested by FBI agents and task force officers at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey upon his arrival from Paris, France, based on a federal warrant for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein's Initial Court Appearance
events.description: Epstein was to be held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center until his initial court appearance scheduled for July 8, 2019.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on July 6, 2019, at approximately 6:12 PM at Teterboro Airport in New Jersey.
The arrest was based on a federal warrant issued in the Southern District of New York for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking.
Epstein arrived at Teterboro on his private plane (tail number N212JE) from Paris, France, and was processed by Customs and Border Protection (CBP) before his arrest.
The arrest involved multiple FBI Special Agents, Task Force Officers, and CBP agents, though their names are not provided in the extract.
Epstein was transported to the Metropolitan Correctional Center to await his initial court appearance on July 8, 2019.
